summary.span: 表示十进制数。

span.span: Represents a decimal number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值类型表示十进制数字范围从 79228162514264337593543950335 到负的 79228162514264337593543950335。The value type represents decimal numbers ranging from positive 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 to negative 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335. 默认值`Decimal`为 0。The default value of a `Decimal` is 0. 值类型不适合于需要大量的有效整数和小数位数和无舍入误差的财务计算。The value type is appropriate for financial calculations that require large numbers of significant integral and fractional digits and no round-off errors. 类型不会消除舍入的需要。The type does not eliminate the need for rounding. 相反，它最大程度减少由于舍入导致的错误。Rather, it minimizes errors due to rounding. 例如，下面的代码生成而不是 1 0.9999999999999999999999999999 结果。For example, the following code produces a result of 0.9999999999999999999999999999 instead of 1. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#1)] 当将除法和乘法的结果传递给方法，结果不会有损失的精度，如以下代码所示。When the result of the division and multiplication is passed to the method, the result suffers no loss of precision, as the following code shows. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#2)] 十进制数是包含一个符号的浮点值、 其中的值中的每一位范围从 0 到 9 的数字值和一个比例因子，指示用于分隔的整数和小数部分的十进浮动小数点的位置数字值。A decimal number is a floating-point value that consists of a sign, a numeric value where each digit in the value ranges from 0 to 9, and a scaling factor that indicates the position of a floating decimal point that separates the integral and fractional parts of the numeric value. 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 96 位整数和比例因子用作拆分 96 位整数，并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分的值组成。The binary representation of a value consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the 96-bit integer and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 因此的二进制表示形式值窗体上，((-296为 296) / 10(0 到 28))，其中的 (296-1)等同于，和第 296-1 等同于。Therefore, the binary representation of a value the form, ((-296 to 296) / 10(0 to 28)), where -(296-1) is equal to , and 296-1 is equal to . 有关详细信息有关的二进制表示形式值和示例，请参阅构造函数和方法。For more information about the binary representation of values and an example, see the constructor and the method. 比例因子还保留了任何尾随零中数。The scaling factor also preserves any trailing zeros in a number. 尾随零不会影响的值数字在算术或比较操作中。Trailing zeros do not affect the value of a number in arithmetic or comparison operations. 但是，尾随零可能会泄露由方法如果应用了相应的格式字符串。However, trailing zeros might be revealed by the method if an appropriate format string is applied. ## 有关转换的注意事项Conversion Considerations 此类型提供转换的方法值来回， ， ， ， ， ， ，和值。This type provides methods that convert values to and from , , , , , , , and values. 从这些到整型的转换扩大转换，永远不会丢失信息或引发异常。Conversions from these integral types to are widening conversions that never lose information or throw exceptions. 从转换到任何整型类型属于收缩转换，舍入到最近的接近零的整数值的值。Conversions from to any of the integral types are narrowing conversions that round the value to the nearest integer value toward zero. 某些语言中的，如 C# 中，还支持的转换值复制到值。Some languages, such as C#, also support the conversion of values to values. 如果这些转换的结果不能在目标类型中，表示引发异常。If the result of these conversions cannot be represented in the destination type, an exception is thrown. 类型还提供了将转换的方法值来回和值。The type also provides methods that convert values to and from and values. 从转换到或属于收缩转换，可能会丢失精度，但不是有关信息的量值的转换后的值。Conversions from to or are narrowing conversions that might lose precision but not information about the magnitude of the converted value. 转换不会引发异常。The conversion does not throw an exception. 从转换或到引发异常如果转换的结果不能表示为。Conversions from or to throw an exception if the result of the conversion cannot be represented as a . ## 对十进制值执行操作Performing Operations on Decimal Values 类型支持标准的数学运算，例如加法、 减法、 除法、 乘法和一元求反。The type supports standard mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, and unary negation. 你还可以直接使用的二进制表示形式值通过调用方法。You can also work directly with the binary representation of a value by calling the method. 比较两个值，你可以使用标准数值比较运算符，也可以调用或方法。To compare two values, you can use the standard numeric comparison operators, or you can call the or method. 你还可以调用的成员类来执行各种数值操作，包括获取绝对值的数值的数字，确定两个最大或最小值值，获取数字的符号和舍入一个数字。You can also call the members of the class to perform a wide range of numeric operations, including getting the absolute value of a number, determining the maximum or minimum value of two values, getting the sign of a number, and rounding a number. ## Examples 以下代码示例演示了 的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 大量 96 位整数和一个比例因子，用于分隔整数并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分的数字组成。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. `bits` 是 32 位有符号整数的四个元素长数组。`bits` is a four-element long array of 32-bit signed integers. `bits` [0] `bits` [1] 和`bits`[2] 包含 96 位整数号的低、 中和高 32 位。`bits` [0], `bits` [1], and `bits` [2] contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. `bits` [3] 包含的缩放比例和的登录，并且以下部分组成：`bits` [3] contains the scale factor and sign, and consists of following parts: 位 0 到 15 之间，较低的字，未使用，且必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 16 到 23 位必须包含指示用整数数字除以 10 的能力介于 0 到 28，之间指数。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 24 到 30 位未使用，必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 第 31 位包含登录;0 含义正数、 和 1 表示负数。Bit 31 contains the sign; 0 meaning positive, and 1 meaning negative. 数字值可能有几个可能的二进制表示形式;所有都是同样有效，数字等效。A numeric value might have several possible binary representations; all are equally valid and numerically equivalent. 请注意，位表示形式区分正负零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 这些值被视为相等的所有操作。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建几个`Decimal`数字使用初始化的构造函数重载`Decimal`具有四个数组的结构值。The following code example creates several `Decimal` numbers using the constructor overload that initializes a `Decimal` structure with an array of four values. span.para: 编译器重载决策可能应对明显的差异的两个行为方法重载。如果之间的隐式转换自变量和一个定义和自变量并不类型化为，编译器可能会执行隐式转换和调用方法。否则，它们调用方法，始终返回如果其参数不是值。下面的示例阐释了两个方法重载之间的行为差异。对于所有基元的整数类型，程序包括签名和无符号类型，第一个比较返回因为编译器自动执行一个的扩大转换，调用方法，而第二个比较返回由于编译器调用方法。 [！ code-csharp[System.Decimal.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.decimal.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#2)][！ code-vb[System.Decimal.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.decimal.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#2)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers may perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of all primitive integral types, including both signed and unsigned types, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. span.span: A 32-bit signed integer array with four elements that contain the binary representation of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 二进制表示形式1 位符号、 大量 96 位整数和一个比例因子，用于分隔整数并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分的数字组成。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放因子是隐式数字 10，范围从 0 到 28 的指数。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 返回值为一个四个元素的数组的 32 位有符号整数。The return value is a four-element array of 32-bit signed integers. 第一，第二，并返回的数组的第三个元素包含 96 位整数号的低、 中和高 32 位。The first, second, and third elements of the returned array contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. 返回数组的第四个元素包含的缩放比例和登录。The fourth element of the returned array contains the scale factor and sign. 它由以下部分组成：It consists of the following parts: 位 0 到 15 之间，较低的字，未使用，且必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 16 到 23 位必须包含指示用整数数字除以 10 的能力介于 0 到 28，之间指数。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 24 到 30 位未使用，必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 第 31 位包含符号： 0 意味着正，而 1 表示负数。Bit 31 contains the sign: 0 mean positive, and 1 means negative. 请注意，位表示形式区分正负零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 这些值被视为相等的所有操作。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的示例使用`GetBits`方法将多个转换`Decimal`为其等效的二进制表示形式的值。The following example uses the `GetBits` method to convert several `Decimal` values to their equivalent binary representations. 它将显示的十进制值和元素的十六进制值中返回的数组方法。It then displays the decimal values and the hexadecimal value of the elements in the array returned by the method. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CPP/getbits.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CS/getbits.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/VB/getbits.vb#2)] 下面的示例使用方法来检索数组的组成部分。The following example uses the method to retrieve the component parts of an array. 然后，它使用此数组的调用中构造函数实例化一个新值。It then uses this array in the call to the constructor to instantiate a new value. span.span: Defines an implicit conversion of the value of a type to a value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载方法定义的类型，编译器可自动转换从中而无需使用显式强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或调用转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中) 的值。The overloads of the method define the types from which the compiler can automatically convert a value without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它们扩大转换，不会丢失数据，不会引发异常。They are widening conversions that do not involve data loss and do not throw an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 参数`s`包含大量的窗体：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|特定于区域性的千位分隔符符号。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 参数`s`使用解释样式。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符可以但不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 显式定义的元素 (如货币符号、 千位分隔符和空白) 的可出现在`s`，可以使用两种或方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use either the or the method. 参数`s`分析使用中的格式设置信息初始化针对当前系统区域性。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 若要分析使用的格式信息的一些其他区域性的字符串，请使用或方法。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other culture, use the or method. 如有必要的值`s`使用舍入到最接近舍入。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. A有 29 位精度。A has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`表示的数字，有多个 29 个数字，但具有小数部分，可以在范围内和，数字舍入，不会被截断，到使用舍入到最接近的 29 位。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在分析操作过程中遇到分隔符`s`参数，以及适用的货币或十进制数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作假定该分隔符是小数分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法，以便分析的字符串表示形式之间实现值。The following code example uses the method to parse string representations of values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载方法通常用于将可在多个方面与格式设置的文本转换值。This overload of the method is commonly used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可以用于将转换到 HTML 文本框中为数值用户输入的文本。For example, it can be used to convert the text entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s`参数包含一个数字的窗体：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|特定于区域性的千位分隔符符号。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`参数被解释使用样式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符可以但不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义的元素 (如货币符号、 千位分隔符和空白区域)，可出现在`s`，使用方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`参数是实现，如或对象。The `provider` parameter is an implementation, such as a or object. `provider`参数提供区域性特定信息在分析中使用。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. A对象有 29 位精度。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`表示的数字，有多个 29 个数字，但具有小数部分，可以在范围内和，数字舍入，不会被截断，到使用舍入到最接近的 29 位。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在遇到分隔符`s`期间执行分析操作，并适用的货币或小数位的参数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作假定该分隔符是小数分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例是按钮单击事件处理程序的 Web 窗体。The following example is the button click event handler of a Web form. 它使用返回的数组属性来确定用户的区域设置。It uses the array returned by the property to determine the user's locale. 它然后实例化对应于该区域设置的对象。It then instantiates a object that corresponds to that locale. 对象所属的对象随后会传递给方法将用户输入转换为值。The object that belongs to that object is then passed to the method to convert the user's input to a value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的行为遵循 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 部分。The behavior of this method follows IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 这种舍入有时称为*舍入一半甚至*或*银行家舍入法*。This kind of rounding is sometimes called *round half to even* or *banker's rounding*. 它最小化而导致的持续舍入中在单方向上的中点值舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. 它等效于调用方法替换`mode`参数。It is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of . ## Examples 下面的示例将舍入的一系列介于 100 和 102 到最接近的整数的值。The following example rounds a range of values between 100 and 102 to the nearest integer. 由于该方法使用银行家舍入，请注意 100.5 到 100 和 101.5 舍入到 102 将舍入。Because the method uses banker's rounding, note that 100.5 rounds to 100 and 101.5 rounds to 102. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Round#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/cs/Round1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Round#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/vb/Round1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于调用方法替换`mode`参数。当`d`为完全偶数两个舍入的值，结果是最右边小数位中有偶数位的舍入的值。This method is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of .When `d` is exactly halfway between two rounded values, the result is the rounded value that has an even digit in the far right decimal position. 例如，当舍入为两位小数时，值 2.345 变成 2.34，而值 2.355 变成 2.36。For example, when rounded to two decimals, the value 2.345 becomes 2.34 and the value 2.355 becomes 2.36. 此过程被称为*向偶舍*，或*银行家舍入法*。This process is known as *rounding toward even*, or *banker's rounding*. 它最小化而导致的持续舍入中在单方向上的中点值舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. ## Examples 下面的示例将多个舍入`Decimal`限于指定数目的使用的小数位数的值`Round`方法。The following example rounds several `Decimal` values to a specified number of decimal places using the `Round` method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在点值，结果中的最低有效位数后的值是两个数字之间精确的一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，7.5 是点值，如果它是要舍入为整数。For example, 7.5 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 对于点值，而无需使用舍入的约定，由指定最接近的值无法轻松地标识操作`mode`自变量。For midpoint values, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两个舍入约定用于处理中点值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 从零开始的舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中点值舍入为从零开始的下一个编号。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.5 则舍入为 4，5 到 4.5 轮次，-3.5 舍入到-4，和-4.5 对齐舍入到-5。For example, 3.5 rounds to 4, 4.5 rounds to 5, -3.5 rounds to -4, and -4.5 rounds to -5. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 向远离零舍入是舍入最广为人知的窗体。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 舍入甚至，或银行家舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中点值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.5 和 4.5 舍入为 4，和-3.5 和-4.5 对齐舍入到-4。For example, both 3.5 and 4.5 round to 4, and both -3.5 and -4.5 round to -4. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入到最接近是舍入财务和统计操作中使用的标准形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 部分。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多个舍入操作中使用时，它减少了引起持续舍入的一个方向的中点值则舍入误差。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入误差非常显著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例显示返回的值方法，方法替换`mode`参数，和方法替换`mode`参数。The following example displays values returned by the method, the method with a `mode` argument of , and the method with a `mode` argument of . remarks.format: ## Remarks `decimals`参数返回的值中指定的数有效小数位数和范围从 0 到 28。The `decimals` parameter specifies the number of significant decimal places in the return value and ranges from 0 to 28. 如果`decimals`为零，则返回整数。If `decimals` is zero, an integer is returned. 在点值，结果中的最低有效位数后的值是两个数字之间精确的一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，3.47500 是如果它是由一个点值舍入两个小数位，而且 7.500 为点值是要舍入为整数。For example, 3.47500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded two decimal places, and 7.500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 在这些情况下，而无需使用舍入的约定，由指定最接近的值不能轻松地标识操作`mode`自变量。In these cases, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两个舍入约定用于处理中点值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 从零开始的舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中点值舍入为从零开始的下一个编号。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.75 舍入到 3.8，3.85 舍入到 3.9，-3.75 舍入到-3.8，和-3.85 舍入到-3.9。For example, 3.75 rounds to 3.8, 3.85 rounds to 3.9, -3.75 rounds to -3.8, and -3.85 rounds to -3.9. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 向远离零舍入是舍入最广为人知的窗体。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 舍入甚至，或银行家舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中点值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.75 和 3.85 舍入到 3.8，和-3.75 和-3.85 舍入到-3.8。For example, both 3.75 and 3.85 round to 3.8, and both -3.75 and -3.85 round to -3.8. 这种形式的舍入由枚举成员。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入到最接近是舍入财务和统计操作中使用的标准形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE 标准 754，第 4 部分。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多个舍入操作中使用时，它减少了引起持续舍入的一个方向的中点值则舍入误差。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入误差非常显著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法替换枚举。The following example demonstrates how to use the method with the enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 参数`value`舍入为最近的接近零，整数值并返回结果。Parameter `value` is rounded to the nearest integer value toward zero, and that result is returned. 你还可以将转换通过为 8 位无符号整数的值赋值运算符。You can also convert a value to an 8-bit unsigned integer by using the assignment operator. 由于该运算符执行收缩转换，必须使用强制转换运算符在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的转换函数。Because the operator performs a narrowing conversion, you must use a casting operator in C# or a conversion function in Visual Basic. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换为十进制数字值。The following example uses the method to convert decimal numbers to values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式通过使用当前区域性的约定指定的格式的值。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要使用默认值 （"G"或常规） 格式或指定不同的区域性，请使用其他重载的方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 方法使用指定的标准或自定义数字格式字符串`format`参数将当前实例的值转换为其字符串表示形式。The method uses the standard or custom numeric format string specified by the `format` parameter to convert the value of the current instance into its string representation. `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)除外 D、 R，X，以及的任意组合[自定义数字格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric format specifier](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) except for D, R, and X, as well as any combination of [custom numeric format specifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`是`null`或空字符串，此实例的返回值格式与常规的数字格式说明符 (G)。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value of this instance is formatted with the general numeric format specifier (G). .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回值的格式使用为当前区域性的对象。The return value is formatted by using the object for the current culture. 若要将应用指定的区域性的格式设置约定，请调用方法。To apply the formatting conventions of a specified culture, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例显示值使用每个支持标准数字格式说明符，以及两个自定义数字格式字符串。The following example displays a value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers, together with two custom numeric format strings. 在将数字的值转换为字符串，该示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定。In converting the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载区别通过返回一个布尔值，该值指示是否分析操作成功，而不是返回的已分析的数字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 不必使用异常处理来测试是否的事件中`s`无效，无法成功分析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. 参数`s`包含大量的窗体：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|特定于区域性的千位分隔符符号。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 参数`s`使用解释样式。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符可以但不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义的元素 (如货币符号、 千位分隔符和空白区域)，可出现在`s`，使用方法重载。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. 参数`s`分析使用中的格式设置信息初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 为分析字符串使用的格式信息的一些其他指定区域性，请使用方法重载。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 如有必要的值`s`使用舍入到最接近舍入。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. A对象有 29 位精度。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`表示的数字，有多个 29 个数字，但具有小数部分，可以在范围内和，数字舍入，不会被截断，到使用舍入到最接近的 29 位。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在分析操作过程中遇到分隔符`s`参数，以及适用的货币或十进制数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作假定该分隔符是小数分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换的字符串表示形式个数值赋给值。The following example uses the method to convert the string representations of numeric values to values. 它假设该 EN-US 当前区域性。It assumes that en-US is the current culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载区别通过返回一个布尔值，该值指示是否分析操作成功，而不是返回的已分析的数字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 不必使用异常处理来测试是否的事件中`s`无效，无法成功分析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `style`参数定义的允许的格式`s`分析操作成功的参数。The `style` parameter defines the allowable format of the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 以下不支持成员：The following members are not supported: - - 根据样式的值`s`参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of style, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空格可以出现的开始处`s`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 它可以在末尾显示`s`如果`style`包括标志。It can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定于区域性的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字符串中的位置由或属性返回对象方法`provider`参数。Its position in the string is defined by the or properties of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 货币符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `style`参数指定所允许的格式`s`参数，并且一个或多个可以枚举常量使用按位或运算组合在一起。The `style` parameter specifies the permitted format of the `s` parameter, and can be one or more enumerated constants combined using a bitwise OR operation. 如果`style`为 null，`s`使用解释样式。If `style` is null, `s` is interpreted using the style. `provider`参数是如实现或对象。The `provider` parameter is an implementation such as a or object. `provider`参数提供区域性特定信息在分析中使用。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. A对象有 29 位精度。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`表示的数字，有多个 29 个数字，但具有小数部分，可以在范围内和，数字舍入，不会被截断，到使用舍入到最接近的 29 位。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在遇到分隔符`s`期间执行分析操作，并适用的货币或小数位的参数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作假定该分隔符是小数分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用方法，以便分析的字符串表示形式具有特定样式和格式都是使用特定区域性的约定的数字。The following example demonstrates the use of the method to parse the string representation of a number that has a particular style and is formatted using the conventions of a particular culture.
